data.title: North Dakota Picnic in Arizona
data.meta_description: Come join thousands of North Dakotans in the annual picnic event in Arizona.  Reconnect with old friends and make new ones at this fun event, the first Sunday in March.
data.text:
Almost every year, for over 50 years, thousands of North Dakotans have gathered in Mesa, AZ, for the North Dakota Picnic in early March. It’s a fun event for friends and former neighbors who enjoy Arizona sunshine but still call North Dakota “home”.

An estimated 3,000 people attended the 2024 ND Picnic, held on March 3rd. Hosted by the North Dakota Community Foundation, the event included entertainment (music by Vic Schwahn, Rick Senger, Gordy "Crazyfingers" Lindquist, Colleen Reinhardt, and Sam & the Band), 40 classic cars on display, and numerous vendor booths. The real draw, however, is finding old friends and former neighbors in the crowd.

Check out the photos below from previous ND Picnics. And join us in 2025 for another great gathering!

2025 ND Picnic in AZ

Sunday, March 2, 2025

10 am - 2:30 pm

Red Mountain Park in Mesa, AZ

Cost: A $5 per person registration fee is requested, to help defray the costs of hosting the picnic.

Follow the ND Picnic in AZ on Facebook for updates and to connect with friends before the event!

If you have any questions or would like more information about being a sponsor or vendor at this event, contact Deb at 701-222-8349 or at Deb@NDCF.net.

Thank You to our 2024 Picnic Sponsors!
